issues.description: The problem statement and template expect Milkable.messageOnMilk() to be a parameterless method returning a String (see UML and Part 2 description). However, the solution repository defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (i.e., it requires a double parameter) and Seal/Goat implement messageOnMilk(double). This is a signature mismatch: students following the problem/template will implement messageOnMilk() with no parameters, but the provided solution uses a parameterized signature. This contradicts the specification and will confuse students (and can cause compilation/type errors when comparing or combining code).
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/template by changing the Milkable interface and all implementations to use the parameterless signature messageOnMilk(): String and returning the string in the format described in the problem (e.g., "Seal Clarabelle is milked" / "Goat Buttinsky is milked"). Alternatively, if a volume parameter is intentionally desired, update the problem statement, UML, and template usage to declare and use messageOnMilk(double volume) consistently and update example outputs accordingly. The recommended fix is to remove the double parameter from solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Milkable.java and update Seal.java and Goat.java to implement messageOnMilk() with no arguments and corresponding return values.

issues.description: The problem statement and template expect a parameterless messageOnMilk() method that returns a string like "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (UML and textual specification). The solution repository instead defines Milkable.messageOnMilk(double volume) (adds a double parameter) and the Seal/Goat implementations use that parameter and return strings with a volume suffix (e.g. "Seal Clarabelle is milked (xL)"). This is a signature and return-value mismatch: template Main calls m.messageOnMilk() with no arguments, and the UML/text specify a no-arg method. The differing method signature/behavior in the solution creates mapping confusion and will cause compile/runtime mismatch with the provided template and the exercise specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem/template by changing the Milkable interface to declare a parameterless method: String messageOnMilk(); then update Seal.java and Goat.java to implement messageOnMilk() returning exactly "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (e.g. return "Seal " + getName() + " is milked"). Alternatively, if the volume parameter is intended, update the problem statement and template (Main.java) to specify and call messageOnMilk(double volume), but the simpler fix is to remove the volume parameter from the solution to match the exercise specification.
